gui

Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • gui.GUI

  • public class GUI
extends java.util.Observable
    GUI class is used by the Application class to quick start the user's view of the app. GUI only requires an Application so it can associate itself and later call methods from that class. This class is observable aNd will update itself whenever the user implements different tools/rules.
    Author:
    ES1-2019-IC1-24

    • Constructor Detail

      • GUI

        public GUI(Application app)

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Init will create the JFrame that will appear to the user. It includes: a menu bar; a panel for the user to click and view the file in another panel, in a JTable format; a panel where the user chooses either a tool or rule and later on shows the defects that were counted in separate labels, according to their nature (if the metric chosen is a rule it will also show the method ids that showed conflict).

      • actions

        public void actions()
        Actions adds the actionListeners to the components of the JFrame, when needed. The buttons 'View File' and 'Apply' prompt action from the application. The listener of the View button responds by getting the Excel sheet from the FileReader on the Application and then placing it on the JTable on the corresponding panel. On the other hand, the listener on the Apply button will react depending on which option the user has chosen on the comboBox and act upon it by creating another frame.

      • createToolFrame

        public void createToolFrame()
        CreateToolFrame will open a new JFrame that contains a comboBox and an 'Apply' button. The option on the comboBox are the two tools the user may use. This method also contains the listener to the 'Apply' button, that will close the previously created frame and tell the application which tool was chosen, so the labels on the main frame will change to the numbers calculated by the Application (calling methods on the FileReader and CounterSystem classes).

      • createRuleFrame

        public void createRuleFrame()
        CreateRuleFrame will open a new JFrame that contains a comboBox and an 'Apply' button. The option on the comboBox are the two rules the user may use. This method also contains the listener to the 'Apply' button, that will close the previously created frame and tell the instance which rule was chosen, calling the createSpecificRuleFrame method.

      • createSpecificRuleFrame

        public void createSpecificRuleFrame(java.lang.String nameRule)
        CreateSpecificRuleFrame will open a new JFrame that contains a series of fields that the user has to fill, including comboBoxes and textfields. It also has an 'Apply' button. The Frame created will depend on the parameter passed. It can be one of the following two options: 'Long Method' or 'Feature Envy'. This method also contains the listener to the 'Apply' button, that will close this frame and convert the rule created into a string, that will show up on the main window and will be used to obtain a list of the methods that follow that rule. If the user inserts invalid text on the number fields, a warning will be given in the form of a dialog frame.
        Parameters:
        nameRule - - the name of the rule that was chosen by the user on the previous step.

      • setToolOrRuleComboBox

        public void setToolOrRuleComboBox(javax.swing.JComboBox toolOrRuleComboBox)
        Set a JComboBox in place of the attribute 'toolOrRuleComboBox'.
        Parameters:
        toolOrRuleComboBox - - JComboBox to set.

      • getCurrentRule

        public java.lang.String getCurrentRule()
        Returns:
        the latest rule the user applied.

      • setCurrentRule

        public void setCurrentRule(java.lang.String currentRule)
        Change the current rule to the one given.
        Parameters:
        currentRule - - rule to define as the attribute 'currentRule'.

      • setAnotherWindowOpen

        public void setAnotherWindowOpen(java.lang.Boolean anotherWindowOpen)
        This method is used to control the creation of the auxiliar windows.
        Parameters:
        anotherWindowOpen - - value that will change the 'anotherWindowOpen'.

      • createAndShowGUI

        public static void createAndShowGUI()
        CreateAndShowGUI serves as an entry point to the Window created, calling the init() and actions() methods.
